meta.content: Countryside Academy is a tuition-free, Young 5s -12 public school serving approximately 700 students and their families in Southwest Michigan.

div.p: Countryside will be updating announcements and resources for families here. Read Full Story for the latest updates, or scroll down to the news section to find it there.

img.alt: Class of 2018 Graduates standing in hallway
Mr. Frazee and Kite Project Students

div.div: Countryside Academy is a tuition-free, Young 5s - 12th Grade public school system serving approximately 750 students and their families in Southwest Michigan. We are located in Berrien County, three miles from Benton Harbor on a 98 acre site with a greenhouse, woods, ponds, stream and gardens. Countryside Academy's Early Learning Center at Millburg for Young 5s - 1st Grades sits on 8 acres. We utilize FARE (Food, Agriculture, Renewable Resources, and Environment) activities throughout the district.

article.aria-label: Millburg Student of the Month Lunch

h3.a: Millburg Student of the Month Lunch

div.div: Countryside will be updating announcements and resources for families here. Read Full Story for the latest updates, or scroll down to the news section to find it there.

article.aria-label: Mr. Rigoni Named Agriculture Educator of the Year!

h3.a: Mr. Rigoni Named Agriculture Educator of the Year!

div.div: During National Agriculture Week, March 22-28, Michigan Farm Bureau (MFB) announced Steve Rigoni of Countryside Academy in Benton Harbor as its educator of the year.

article.a: Child Care Social Media Badge Poster

div.div: Executive Order 2020-16 calls upon Michigan’s ISDs to coordinate community efforts to support child care needs for essential workers during the COVID-19 crisis. Berrien RESA, Lewis Cass ISD and Van Buren ISD are answering the call and have developed a plan in collaboration with Southwest Child Care Resources and United Way of Southwest Michigan, and in special partnership with the YMCA of Michiana.

article.aria-label: Countryside to Provide Breakfast and Lunch to Those Under 18 During Closure

h3.a: Countryside to Provide Breakfast and Lunch to Those Under 18 During Closure

div.div: Countryside Academy will be providing free breakfast and lunch to all students 18 years old and younger once a week. First Student and JA Food Service are working with Countryside to provide these meals. Meals will consist of 7 days of nonperishable, “grab and go meals” as supplies last.

video.alt: Various scenes around Countryside Academy highlighting activities and community
